# heathpopR <a href="https://janikmiet.github.io/healthpopR/"><img src="man/figures/logo.png" align="right" height="138" alt="healthpopR website" /></a>

## Overview

**healthpopR** helps researchers and analysts classify populations into exposure and response groups, visualize ICD-10-based health profiles, and perform survival and Cox regression analysis using tidy workflows.

The package is designed for analyzing how exposure diagnoses affect response diagnoses in population health data research. Package uses regex code for identifying ICD-10/9/8 codes. 

The goal of healthpopR is to help analyze the connection between exposure diagnoses and response diagnoses. A real-life example would be investigating how a diagnosis of diabetes influences the risk of developing heart failure.


## Installation

Install the development version from GitHub:

```
# Install healthpopR
remotes::install_github("janikmiet/healthpopR")
```
